page.title: 04BIRSTALL PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Birstall Parish Council came into being in 1894. It is made up of 21 Parish Councillors (elected every 4 years), 2 County Councillors and 3 District Councillors. The Parish Councillors must live within 3 miles of Birstall. The council owns and maintains 3 playing fields, a cemetery, some allotments and they are responsible for street lighting except on main roads. They employ 3 part-time workers to run offices on Sibson Road. At the monthly meetings, vandalism, litter and the state of the playing fields are discussed. A meeting in May discussed objections to proposed toilets for the shopping centre and the date of a Medieval Banquet to be held when Birstall receives guests from Rixensart, its twin town in Belgium.
